field_site_host: Northern Research Station, US Forest Service
field_access_details: Bartlett Experimental Forest has very limited staff and the USFS personnel are NOT available to support external researchers. Permitting requests for research activities should be submitted at least 6 months prior to planned start.
field_domint_plant_species: Fagus grandifolia (American beech)|Tsuga canadensis (Eastern hemlock)|Acer rubrum (Red maple)

field_site_name: Lyndon B. Johnson National Grassland NEON
field_access_details: Researchers should coordinate directly with the US Forest Service for permitting and approval. Site host is very limited to external research requests.
Reseachers should coordinate with the site manager.
field_domint_plant_species: Bouteloua gracilis (Blue grama)|Hesperostipa comata (Needle-and-thread grass)|Thelesperma filifolium (Stiff greenthread)
field_megapit_soil_family: Fine, loamy, mixed, superactive, mesic.  Aridic Argiustolls.

field_access_details: This area is primarily intended to provide recreational opportunities and is also classified as a hunting area. As such, access is very limited but potentially possible.
field_domint_plant_species: Quercus nigra (Water oak)|Celtis laevigata (Sugarberry)|Acer rubrum (Red maple)
field_megapit_soil_family: Fine, mixed, semiactive, thermic. Aquic Paleudults.

field_access_details: New research requests may be restricted to limited portions of the preserve - coordination required with preserve management.
field_domint_plant_species: Andropogon virginicus (broomsedge bluestem)|Aristida beyrichia (wiregrass)|Axonopus furcatus (big carpetgrass)

field_site_name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park NEON
field_access_details: The National Park Service is open to additional research activities taking place in this area. Apply via IRMA Permitting portal.
field_domint_plant_species: Liriodendron tulipifera (tulip tree/yellow poplar)|Lindera benzoin (spicebush)|Acer rubrum (red maple)
field_megapit_soil_family: Loamy, skeletal, isotic, mesic.  Typic Humudepts.

field_site_host: Harvard University|Massachusetts DCR Division of Water Supply Protection
field_access_details: Field site managed by Harvard University - open to additional research via the Harvard Experimental Forest website. Many other colocated research projects within NEON area. / Field site located in the Quabbin Resevoir - Massachusetts DCR Division of Water Supply Protection . This property is very limited to additional research - researchers should take necessary coordinations with the DCR.
field_domint_plant_species: Osmunda cinnamomea (Cinmon fern)|Quercus rubra (Northern red oak)|Tsuga cadensis (Eastern hemlock)
field_megapit_soil_family: Coarse, loamy over sandy or sandy, skeletal, mixed, semiactive, frigid.  Oxyaquic Dystrudepts.

field_access_details: JORN encourages research activities that do not conflict with on-going activities. Please apply directly with site host and USDA for a site research permit.  All requests are reviewed for impacts to cultural resources, endangered species and other research activities.
field_domint_plant_species: Prosopis glandulosa (honey mesquite)|Yucca elata (soaptree yucca)|Bouteloua eriopoda (black grama grass)
field_megapit_soil_family: Coarse, loamy, mixed, superactive, thermicc. Typic Petrocalcids.

field_site_host: The Nature Conservancy, Kansas State University
field_access_details: The Nature Conservancy and Konza Prairie Biological Station (KSU) welcomes and encourages research use that fits their mission and is compatible with their abilities as a host. Please plan on at more than two weeks advance notice to request and plan site access.
field_domint_plant_species: Cornus drummondii (Roughleaf Dogwood)|Schizachyrium scoparium (Little Bluestem)|Andropogon gerardii (Big Bluestem)
field_megapit_soil_family: Fine, smectitic, mesic. Pachic Udertic Argiustolls.

field_site_host: University of Virginia|George Washington and Jefferson National Forest
field_access_details: Mountain Lake Biological Station is open to additional research activities taking place in this area. / Researchers should coordinate directly with the US Forest Service for permitting and approval.
field_domint_plant_species: Acer rubrum (red maple)|Quercus alba (northern red oak)|Quercus rubra (white oak)
field_megapit_soil_family: The dominant wind direction is west-northwest.

field_site_name: Marvin Klemme Range Research Station NEON
field_access_details: Reseachers should coordinate with the site manager.
field_domint_plant_species: Bouteloua dactyloides (buffalo grass)|Bouteloua gracilis (blue grama)|Bouteloua curtipendula (sideoats grama)

field_access_details: Reseachers should coordinate with the site manager and submit a site research permit.
field_domint_plant_species: Artemisia tridentata (big sagebrush)|Ceratocephala testiculata (curveseed butterwort)|Bromus tectorum (cheatgrass)
field_megapit_soil_family: Fine, loamy, mixed, superactive, mesic. Xeric Haplocalcids.

field_access_details: Significant portions of the site are off-limits or have restricted access due to captive animal activities. Annual hunting activities may render this area completely inaccessible for short periods of time (1 or 2 days) over the course of the season. Most research activities require approval from a land-use committee; and stays longer than a month may require the researcher to apply for contractor credentials and submit to a background check.
field_domint_plant_species: Liriodendron tulipifera (tulip tree)|Microstegium vimineum (Japanese stiltgrass)|Fraxinus americana (white ash)
field_megapit_soil_family: Loamy, skeletal, mixed, active, mesic. Ultic Hapludalfs.

field_access_details: Some areas of the site have pre-existing experiments and a high density of markers, equipment, sensors etc. Care should be taken to coordinate and avoid impacting on-going work at the site. All researchers must be accompanied while on-site by at least one individual with an approved Visiting Scientist Agreement. Annual hunting activities may render this area completely inaccessible for short periods of time (1 or 2 days) over the course of the season.
field_domint_plant_species: Liriodendron tulipifera (tulip poplar)|Fagus grandifolia (American Beech)|Liquidambar styraciflua (American sweetgum)
field_megapit_soil_family: Fine, loamy, mixed, active, mesic. Aquic Hapludults.

field_access_details: SRER encourages research activities that do not conflict with on-going research. Researchers should apply directly for a site research permit. All proposed actions will be reviewed for potential impacts to cultural resources, endangered species and other research activities.
field_domint_plant_species: Larrea tridentata (creosote bush)|Prosopis veluti (velvet mesquite)|Parkinsonia florida (blue palo verde)

field_access_details: Very limited available via private land owner. / NEON sampling area of this field site is located in Chequamegon Nicolet National Forest. Additional research may take place in this area with site host permission.
field_domint_plant_species: Populus tremuloides (quaking aspen)|Abies balsamea (balsam fir)|Acer rubrum (red maple)
field_megapit_soil_family: Coarse, loamy, mixed, superactive, frigid. Alfic Epiaquods.
